name: socks
text: Lonis Edison's expression in the middle row's far right panel will follow me to my tomb.

name: rational
text:
Just me or does he look a little like Karl Rove?
[IMGS OFF]

name: ashuttleworth
text:
Eisenhower, I'd say.

[IMGS OFF]

name: snowman
text: Klaus Nomi

name: pigs
text: If they start calling Lonis "Turd Blossom", I might actually start crying.

name: spectre
text: A comment left by spectre was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ted0phile, kenthegod, atticusonline)

name: cpnglxynchos
text: how long were the comas?

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
answer:

SO MANY WHALES

name: smoothjimmyapollo
text: When I first read all these strips individually, on the day they came out, I missed hell of details and harkening to the past.

name: connellingus
text: Yeah, this strip really deserves to be rated higher just for revealing the origin of Mexican magical realism after all that build-up.

name: zeal
text: I didn't understand until just now that it was Lonis making these Magical realism products.  Astounding.

name: cracklewater
text:
...and I just realised it when reading (for the third time) the line:

"They didn't need cuspidors with low self esteem. I fled to Mexico to continue my work away from public scrutiny."

Then, I rushed to Acheworld to see if this inference could be confirmed by the learned.

I thank you.

name: tripperday
text: I also just realized this. It's amazing what you can miss the first time you read through the archives.

name: lucid
text:
I enjoyed this arc immensely. Mexican magical realism can be a bit of a get out of jail free card as a plot device, but it always brings the entertainment.

And Lonis' vernacular is really well done, very pleasant to read. I'm kinda sad that it's unlikely we'll meet up with him again.

name: ssddr
text: I thin everyone would be happier if they could create a perfect sine wave of ketchup.

name: geysershitdick
text: A comment left by geysershitdick was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by greatwhitehope7, Vondicus, Deusoma, farqussus, prettyrad, thatcrazycommie)

name: saru
text: Thank you!

name: boredom_man
text: The taste of ketchup on frankfurters is not the aspect we find interesting.

name: farqussus
text: With what would you have us garnish our dogs? I keenly await the miriad of absurdities you are about to suggest.

name: norrec
text: I could care less what people put on their wieners, whether it is ketchup or pancake syrup. I see no reason to get so worked up about food.

name: farqussus
text: I don't recall you being asked, Mister Take Everything So Serious of Modesto California.

name: norrec
text: You mistake my apathy for seriousness :)

name: old_chap
text: Here, norrec, you dropped these: n't.

name: tekende
text: YES. THANK YOU. That is a big pet peeve of mine.

name: darthemed
text: How do you know that there's absolutely no way he could care less? :-)

name: norrec
text:
Oh thanks :)

My bad

name: atticusonline
text: norrec thinks that forgetting to put the "n't" at the end of couldn't merits a "my bad"

name: farqussus
text: a "my bad" warrants a "n't"

name: shutup_shutup
text: Myn't bad!

name: tekende
text: A "My bad" warrants a hanging.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: sorry for partying.

name: atticusonline
text: sorryn't for partyin't

name: spectre
text: onions, sauerkraut, mustard

name: firesign
text: The bar I go to does cheddar and jack cheese, onions, and chili. Very good.

name: pogo
text: Ever have a Chicago dog, dogg?  Mmmmm.  Mustard, onion, relish, pickle, hot pepper, tomatoe and celery salt.

name: shutup_shutup
text: Cream cheese.

name: tonyhighwind
text: Mustard, onions and relish.  Either that or enough chili and cheese to make one wonder if there is even a dog to be found underneath it all.

name: equinn2006
text: I for one wouldn't mind going back to waiting for a haircut to listen to the latest songs.

name: tekende
text: To be fair, most of today's "latest songs" really suck. But I think I would get a bad haircut if I had to listen to, say, Fall-Out Boy's  newest single during a haircut due to the rage-enduced shaking my head would undergo.

name: boredom_man
text: Isn't that ironic, don't you think?

name: tekende
text: I don't see how.

name: boredom_man
text: Um, because I'm under the impression that Alanis Morissette's "Ironic" is still one of the latest songs?

name: shutup_shutup
text: Chubby for being remarkably and aggressively behind the times.

name: crinklebat
text: The crazy thing about old Lonis is how damned cute he is. Even when he's got his scheming face on, I just want to squeeze those little cheeks.

name: stuart
text: Except in profile, which makes him old and freakish.

name: jackparsons
text:
"You have the round thighs of a laugher, but your mind is calculating."

I resolve to work this into all possible social intercourse.

name: tekende
text: I think the best time for it would be while disrobing in order to have sexual intercourse.

name: terribleman
text: You could practice first by working it into a private intercourse.

name: cailetshadow
text: It's true, we invented America primarily because we were so tired of crapping in the dark.

name: falseprophet
text:
"America hated waiting for a haircut just to hear the latest songs."

The phonograph was a way to get your barbershop quartet fix while your ears were still high enough to truly appreciate them. Classic.

name: dickie_roxx
text: 5'd for "forearm ligament structure".

name: rene
text: "Shaped oddly, like a perch with a cramp" is by far the best descriptive statement ever made.

name: telescreen
text: I just noticed the foreshadowing of the ketchup stuff with Bensington pulling out his UGHHHHHH Hunt's Ketchup. Fuck Hunts.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: Heinz. tha best. evar.

name: fatcat
text: Does anyone else think that this Edison fellow looks a bit like Klaus Nomi?

name: joulesisenergy
text: I wonder if this guy invented Cartilage Head's wine bottle?
